Sentencas: The metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), in which a metal plate is bonded to a ceramic cell, was recently introduced as a new fuel cell design.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: Metal-supported SOFCs do not suffer from gas leakage, because the metal plates are welded to the metallic interconnects, which also provides high mechanical strength.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: However, the bonding layer existing between the interconnect and the ceramic cell increases mass transfer resistance, resulting in decreased performance.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: To better understand and control the mass transfer rate, the manifold structure of the fuel cell stack as well as the channel design in each single cell should be studied.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: Using a numerical approach, physical property models, governing equations and electrochemical reaction models were calculated simultaneously.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The experimentally measured current density voltage curves were compared with the simulation data to validate the code.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: Current densities, temperatures and pressure distributions resulting from various manifold designs were presented as numerical results.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The parallel manifold design displayed an average current density of 2820.1 A/m(2) and a relatively uniform current density distribution.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The serpentine design yielded the highest average current density among the studied manifold designs, but the maximum pressure was 32 times higher than with the parallel design.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: Moreover, the large temperature difference observed with the serpentine design may result in a thermal expansion problem.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The expanding manifold design yielded an average current density of 2885.9 A/m(2) and a maximum pressure of 6350 Pa.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The pressure distribution with this manifold design was clearly related to the manifold structure.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The tapering manifold design is the opposite of the expanding manifold; with this design, the average current density and maximum pressure were slightly lower than the expanding manifold.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The dual-flow hybrid manifold design combines two different manifold structures: a serpentine hydrogen manifold and a parallel air manifold.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs

Sentencas: The dual-flow hybrid design yielded an average current density of 2905.4 A/m(2) and a maximum pressure of 750 Pa.
Titulo: Characterization of electrochemical reaction and thermo-fluid flow in metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell stacks with various manifold designs
